meanings.definition: To acculturate or assimilate into a culture.
meanings.sent1: She quickly enculturated into the new community by learning their customs.
meanings.sent2: The immigrants were enculturated into the traditions of their adopted country.
meanings.sent3: The alien from Mars tried to enculturate into human society by wearing a fake mustache.
meanings.sent4: Her love for music enculturated her into the world of classical composers.
meanings.sent5: The magic of the festival enculturated everyone into a joyful celebration.

meanings.definition: To teach or socialize someone into a particular culture.
meanings.sent1: The elders enculturated the young ones with stories of their ancestors.
meanings.sent2: Teachers play a crucial role in enculturating students with knowledge and values.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous puppy tried to enculturate the kittens into its playful ways.
meanings.sent4: The art class enculturated the students into the world of creativity and expression.
meanings.sent5: The scout leader enculturated the new members into the traditions of the troop.
